Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Rev. Aaron Kelly, Greater Faith Temple, 4214 White Plains Rd. Bronx, NY 10466.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member King.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Rev. Aaron Kelly, Greater Faith Temple, 4214 White Plains Rd. Bronx, NY 10466.

Council Member King moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting October 30, 2013 be adopted as printed by Council Member Koppell.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Koppell moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of October 30, 2013 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor
Communications from City, County & Borough Offices
Communication from the Mayor - Withdrawing the name of Iris Weinshall  (M 1307) from consideration at this time for her reappointment to the New York City Taxi & Limousine Commission.
Items.ActionName: Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.MatterName: M 1307 - Iris Weinshall, Taxi & Limousine Commission

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By Council Member James:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Review Procedure Application No. C 130040 MMK shall be subject to Council Review.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Planning, Narrowing by elimination, discontinuance and closing of real property in the Borough of Brooklyn. (C 130040 MMK)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Garodnick:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and §20-226 or §20-225 of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 696 Madison Avenue, Borough of Manhattan, Community Board No. 8, Application No.  20145201 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Sidewalk café, 696 Madison Ave, Manhattan (20145201 TCM)

Introduction & Reading of Bills

Discussion of Resolutions
Resolutions
General Discussion

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring agencies to accept applications for employment by mail.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Requiring agencies to accept applications for employment by mail.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to conducting a study on privately owned streets.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Conducting a study on privately owned streets.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to fossil fuel.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Contracts
Items.MatterName: Fossil fuel

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the charter of the city of New York, in relation to establishing a panel to review regulations related to child day care programs.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Establishing a panel to review regulations related to child day care programs.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the creation of the department of early childhood development, and to repeal paragraph 4 of subdivision a of section 617 of such charter in relation thereto.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Creation of the department of early childhood development, and to repeal paragraph 4 of subdivision a of section 617 of such charter in relation thereto.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York in relation to the noise control code and manufacturing districts.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Noise control code and manufacturing districts.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United States Congress to pass and the President to sign into law the Kosher and Halal Food Act of 2013 (S.811/H.R.1794), which would provide for the increased availability of Kosher and Halal food at food banks and modify the labeling of the commodities list to enable Kosher and Halal food bank operators to identify which commodities to obtain from local food banks.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Kosher and Halal Food Act of 2013 (S.811/H.R.1794)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon fast food restaurants to pay their workers a family-sustaining wage.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Fast food restaurants to pay their workers a family-sustaining wage.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation making driving on the sidewalk a misdemeanor.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Making driving on the sidewalk a misdemeanor.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Governor and the New York State Department of Transportation to implement the recommendations of the Sheridan-Hunts Point Land Use and Transportation Study.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Dept of Transportation to implement the recommendations of the Sheridan-Hunts Point Land Use and Transportation Study.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to extending the rate of the additional tax on the occupancy of hotel rooms.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Extending the rate of the additional tax on the occupancy of hotel rooms.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to the naming of the Queensboro Bridge and the Ed Koch Municipal Building.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Parks and Recreation
Items.MatterName: Naming of the Queensboro Bridge and the Ed Koch Municipal Building.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the neighborhood parks alliance.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Parks and Recreation
Items.MatterName: Neighborhood parks alliance.

Items.Title: Resolution urging the New York State Liquor Authority to require grocery and drug stores licensed to sell beer and/or wine for consumption off-premise, to locate all alcohol and related products in the furthermost area away from the entrance of the store.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: NYS Liquor Authority to require grocery and drug stores licensed to sell beer and/or wine for consumption off-premise, to locate all alcohol and related products in the furthermost area away from the entrance of the store.

Items.Title: Application no. 20145201 TCM, pursuant to §20-226 of the Administrative Code of the City of New York, concerning the petition of Madison Global LLC, d/b/a Nello’s, for a revocable consent to continue to maintain and operate an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 696 Madison Avenue, in the Borough of Manhattan, Community District 8, Council District 4. This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if called-up by vote of the Council pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and §20-226(e) of the New York City Administrative Code.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Sidewalk café, 696 Madison Ave, Manhattan (20145201 TCM)

Items.Title: Application No. C 140001 ZMM submitted by the NYC Department of Housing Preservation and Development, pursuant to Sections 197-c and 201 of the New York City Charter, for the amendment of the Zoning Map, Section No. 8b, changing from an R8A District to an R8 District property bounded by West 19th Street and West 18th Street, in the Borough of Manhattan, Community District 4, Council District 3.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Changing from an R8A District to an R8 District property bounded by West 19th St & West 18th St, Manhattan (C 140001 ZMM)

Items.Title: Application no. C 130040 MMK submitted by Long Island University pursuant to Sections 197-c and 199 of the New York City Charter and Section 5-430 et seq. of the New York City Administrative Code for an amendment to the City map involving the narrowing by elimination, discontinuance and closing of Willoughby Street between Fleet Place and Ashland Place; the narrowing by elimination, discontinuance and closing of Ashland Place between Willoughby Street and DeKalb Avenue; the elimination of Public Place between Willoughby Street, Fleet Street, and Fleet Place; the delineation of public access easements in Willoughby Street and Ashland Place; the adjustment of grades necessitated thereby; including authorization for any acquisition or disposition of real property related thereto, in the Borough of Brooklyn, Community District 2, Council District 34.  This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if appealed to the Council pursuant to 197-d(b)(2) of the Charter or called up by a vote of the Council pursuant to 197-d(b)(3) of the Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Planning, Narrowing by elimination, discontinuance and closing of real property in the Borough of Brooklyn. (C 130040 MMK)

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United States Congress to pass and the President to sign the States' Medical Marijuana Patient Protection Act, which seeks to reclassify marijuana as other than a Schedule I or Schedule II substance.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Health
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Comrie) called for a voice vote.  

The following Council Member formally abstained from voting on this item: Council Member Gentile.

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: States' Medical Marijuana Patient Protection Act.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to designating expanded polystyrene as recyclable.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Designating expanded polystyrene as recyclable.

Items.Title: Application no. 20145201 TCM, pursuant to §20-226 of the Administrative Code of the City of New York, concerning the petition of Madison Global LLC, d/b/a Nello’s, for a revocable consent to continue to maintain and operate an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 696 Madison Avenue, in the Borough of Manhattan, Community District 8, Council District 4. This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if called-up by vote of the Council pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and §20-226(e) of the New York City Administrative Code.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Referred to Comm by Council to the Subcommittee on Zoning and Franchises

Items.Title: Application no. C 130040 MMK submitted by Long Island University pursuant to Sections 197-c and 199 of the New York City Charter and Section 5-430 et seq. of the New York City Administrative Code for an amendment to the City map involving the narrowing by elimination, discontinuance and closing of Willoughby Street between Fleet Place and Ashland Place; the narrowing by elimination, discontinuance and closing of Ashland Place between Willoughby Street and DeKalb Avenue; the elimination of Public Place between Willoughby Street, Fleet Street, and Fleet Place; the delineation of public access easements in Willoughby Street and Ashland Place; the adjustment of grades necessitated thereby; including authorization for any acquisition or disposition of real property related thereto, in the Borough of Brooklyn, Community District 2, Council District 34.  This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if appealed to the Council pursuant to 197-d(b)(2) of the Charter or called up by a vote of the Council pursuant to 197-d(b)(3) of the Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Referred to Comm by Council to the Subcommittee on Planning, Dispositions and Concessions
Items.MatterName: Planning, Narrowing by elimination, discontinuance and closing of real property in the Borough of Brooklyn. (C 130040 MMK)

MICHAEL M. McSWEENEY, City Clerk

Items.MinutesNote: The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Comrie)

The presence of a quorum was announced by The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera).

There is one vacancy presently in the Council (16th Council District, the Bronx) pending the swearing-in of the certified winner of the November 5, 2013 General Election for this seat.
The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Comrie)  put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately:



Int No. 1071, 40-0-1 (Abstention: CM Barron)
Int No. 1185, 40-0-1 (Abstention: CM Barron)

See files for individual votes.
The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Comrie) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such motion which was decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

At this point, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Comrie) declared that the aforementioned items were adopted and referred to the Committee on Land Use and to the appropriate Land Use Subcommittee.
